manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: CoolMesh - Extend Electronic Life, Mitigate Replacement CoolMesh strategically placed ventilation holes work like a heat sink, to stop overheating, extend electronic life and maximize performance - so you can focus on accomplishing tasks, not worrying, pleading it keeps working, or wasting your resources on a new one from you know where.

This Monitor Stand is a Real Back Saver Get your mind off your aching body and back in the game. Ergonomically optimized eye height promotes proper posture, free-flowing circulation and fewer painful distractions for superior productivity and happier days at the office.

Save 5 Weeks a Year, in 5 Minutes Inc studies shows an organized workspace saves you 4.3 hours a week. That’s 223 hours a year, or a full 5.5 weeks you can spend getting ahead, growing your business, or relaxing during a well-deserved vacation. The Ultimate Safety Stand Free up space without placing your computer at risk. With a heavy duty steel frame, a 44 LB maximum capacity, and anti-skid rubber feet, this is the monitor stand to get if you want to ensure your device stays securely atop your desk. Includes Everything You Need Pull it out of the box, screw in the legs and you’re ready to go in 5 minutes. We’ve even included 5 wire ties so you can detangle your current cords and properly secure them, because the cleaner your space, the clearer your brain, and the faster you’ll get it all done.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for work from home desk!
reviews.reviewText: I bought these because my neck was hurting everyday while at my computer desk. I work from home and these are ideal to put monitors right at eye level. Easy peesy to put together, sturdy and adjustable. Love the little drawers too, perfect for post its or a few pens, too shallow for anything bigger, but's that ok with me....leaves room underneath for other items.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It’s is sturdy and easy to assemble. Love the drawer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Easy to put together and adjustable. Definitely a good price

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Just what I needed for my office monitors. Easy to put together. Really like the storage drawer. Very sturdy for the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Don't Hesitate - Buy it!
reviews.reviewText: These are sturdy little workhorses for my two monitors. Prefer this set up as I can readjust how close each monitor is or their direction. VERY sturdy. Great value for money. The only thing I don't like is that there are holes on the top which allows some dust to settle down into the tray underneath. These trays are a bonus to hide paperclips, USBs, and other things. And, the fact that you can adjust the height is awesome. Would definitely recommend it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars No more back pain!
reviews.reviewText: Just raising my monitor 5" has made such a big difference in my upper back and neck. I am much more comfortable now doing my work in front of my monitor. I bought 2 packs (4 risers total) so that I can raise the monitors at my computers at home as well. Cannot recommend this product enough. The build quality is excellent, it is very smooth and feels like quality materials were used in its construction. The only improvement I would like to see the manufacturer consider is making the plastic pull out tray a little more durable. Its fine as it is, but I could see it potentially cracking or breaking down the line with repeated use. Other than that, excellent product!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Computer monitor risers
reviews.reviewText: First off I did read the reviews an honestly I agree with the reviews here's why not because of what they said just wanted to see what the issues could be..The drawers don't pull out that far would be nice if they did but I can live with it. I love these risers they hold up to 44 pounds, there solid steel I think it said, I love the adjustable legs the legs are solid, oh an it came with straps if you wanna strap them together.Love the price, I would so buy more of these for the price perfect I'm a permanent customer.Even though the drawers don't pull out that far I still feel this item deserves 5 stars. That's just me. Either way I love them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Minimal design but helps keep my desk clean!
reviews.reviewText: I work from home full time and also have my game consoles hooked up here, so my desk area has a lot going on. It can easily be cluttered. This product is a simple solution, with a nice minimal design, that is multi purposed.Let’s start with some negatives (there aren’t many):I wish the drawers were about 50% deeper, just to easily stick a sticky note pad in there. Also, I wish the bottoms of the legs had little rubber pads, because if you open or close the drawers too fast the entire stand can wobble and or move out of place slightly. I wish that there was some way to screw multiple on top of each other, just to create a sort of storage tower. It would be nice to have multiple size options, because I would put my printer on top of one of these, and store paper and ink under the riser. I wish they were a little modular like that to fit whatever need you may have.Now, some positives:they are easy to put together. The packaging was nice, and protected the product well. I love that they came in a 2 pack, that’s a nice value. Nice and sleek minimal design, fits my desk aesthetic. Doesn’t look too clunky. I like that the drawer has a dedicated pen and pencil slot at the front. Just keeps things separated in the drawer. The tops have air flow holes which is nice for me as I have my PlayStation sitting on one. It would be very nice to have the legs be slightly bigger, and be hollow, so that you could run wires through them. If you’re like me and don’t like seeing wires, you can do what I have done which is carefully zip tie a cable to the back leg with a black zip tie.A few notes:I actually have my monitors on vesa mounts so I don’t need this to act as a riser. I bought these so that that could provide storage for little things that clutter my desk. I have 2 monitors, and have 2 of them stacked under each monitor (total of 4). I put my misc papers under one monitor as a “to do” pile and under the other monitor I put my notepad and spare sticky notes. Having the pull out drawers help keep my pens, letter openers, misc USB and charging cords nice and tucked away. I like the low profile minimal design as it fits my desk aesthetic. Any idiot can assemble these, they were super easy. overall, I wish the drawers were a little deeper. They are only about 3/4 inch deep. Having them maybe 1-1.5 inches deep would be really nice. Overall, I couldn’t be happier!
Resistente, estético y practico, de gran ayuda

reviews.reviewTitle: Excelentes, y las de bandeja mejores.
reviews.reviewText: Son excelentes, de acero, no bailan, soportan bastante peso. Las de bandeja, son MEJORES

reviews.reviewText: Llegaron a tiempo, son fáciles de instalar y por supuesto ayudar a mantener el orden en mi escritorio
